title: Femi Adesina dismisses rumours of Buhari losing his voice ▷ NAIJ.COM
text: Share on Facebook - The medical vacation of President Muhammadu Buhari is still a major topic in the polity - Rumours have been flying all over the place due to the secrecy that surrounds the president’s health - President Buhari’s spokesman, Femi Adesina has dismissed one of such rumours The senior special assistant to President Muhammadu Buhari on media and publicity, Mr Femi Adesina has dismissed a rumour surrounding the health of his boss. Femi Adesina have asked Nigerians to believe President Muhammadu Buhari Rumours have been flying all over the place due to the secrecy that surrounds the president’s health. PAY ATTENTION: Get the latest News on NAIJ.com News App But Adesina says those making the allegations need to prove it. He said this when he spoke to state house correspondents in Abuja on Tuesday, February 21. “Those people need to prove it. He spoke with President Trump. Did Trump say he did not speak with Nigerian president?” Adesina asked rhetorically. He continued: “Anybody can allege anything. My message to Nigerians is that let us learn to believe our leaders. “This is a man elected into office and he says no cause to worry. Let us believe him.” Adesina added that it is only President Buhari that can disclose the type of ailment that he is currently suffering from. His words: “Don’t you know that the Hippocratic oath even forbids a doctor from speaking about the condition of his patient himself who can speak about what he is going through. “This is the person going through these series of tests and rest and says no cause to worry.let us believe that” President Buhari has been in London since January 19. The presidency had first announced that he was there for a 10-day leave. But he has since extended the leave on medical grounds. Meanwhile, Governor Mohammed Abubakar of Bauchi state has directed religious leaders in the state to commence prayers for President Muhammadu Buhari quick recovery. The governor said they should direct Juma’at Mosques and Churches in their domains to commence the prayers as soon as possible. ​
